page.title: 15MUSEUM CHALFONT ST GILES.
page.content: Milton's Cottage is used to house a small museum of village bygones.There is a large open fireplace and several cooking utensils -iron pots,a large kettle,a ratchet for raising and lower- ing pots so as to vary the heat for cooking.These may have been used by Milton. There is an old lace making pillow and some interesting bobbins, lace making having been a common employ ment for girls and women in this area during the 19th century.(Old Lace School in Seer Green) On the walls hang several paintings of Chalfont St Giles at different times in the past and a copy of the Death Warrant of Charles 1 showing the signature of George Fleet- wood,owner of The Vache,an estate in the village, now an NCB college,which was confiscated by the Crown at the Restoration,as a punishment for his part in the regicide.
